title: Golden Get-Well Soup
ingredients: 2tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
directions: 1. Do some prep:- Thinly slice 10 scallions, reserving about ½ cup of the dark green parts for garnish.- Lightly smash and peel 10 garlic cloves.- Thinly slice 1 (4-inch) piece of ginger lengthwise into planks (no need to peel; just scrub).

2. Start the soup:- Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat.- Add the scallions, garlic, ginger, and 1¼ teaspoons turmeric.- Cook, stirring often, until softened and fragrant but not browned, about 3 to 4 minutes.- Add 1½ pounds chicken thighs, 1 tablespoon salt, 9 cups water, and ¾ cup jasmine rice.- Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then lower heat as needed.- Cook, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the rice breaks down and the soup thickens, 40 to 50 minutes.

3. Shred the chicken:- Remove chicken and let cool on a plate.- Use a spoon to smash the softened garlic against the pot walls to blend into the soup.- Optionally remove the ginger slices.- Shred the chicken, discard skin and bones, then return meat to the pot.

4. Season the soup and serve:- Squeeze in the juice of 2 limes.- Stir in 1 teaspoon black pepper.- Taste and adjust salt as needed.- Ladle into bowls and garnish with reserved scallion greens, cilantro leaves, more black pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil.
